security: Disclosing the association between Roberts and the Agency could expose cover company operations and compromise ongoing intelligence activities. Directly quoting: "when it became apparent that no real business was forthcoming from this group, our interest ceased."
summary: A memo from Eugene Milligan, Chief of CCS/GLOBE, to the Office of the General Counsel, responding to questions about Thomas Lee Roberts' relationship with Itkin and the Conestoga Group, clarifying when LPGLOBE became aware of their proposal to Roberts.
summary_one_paragraph: This February 5, 1969, memorandum from Eugene Milligan, Chief of the Central Cover Staff (CCS)/GLOBE, to the Office of the General Counsel addresses questions raised regarding the relationship between Thomas Lee Roberts and Itkin, particularly regarding the Conestoga Group's approach to Roberts with a business proposal in Africa. The memo clarifies that LPGLOBE was aware of the Conestoga Group by October 27, 1966, but ceased interest when no business materialized and also refers to Robertsâ€™s financial agreement with Itkin's firm dating back to 1961.
title: The Itkin Case
